name: The Margins
definition: I am blissfully name-dropped (and mistakenly referred to as "industrious"!) by Can Duruk in reference to the larger newsletter ecosystem.

name: The Top
definition: Nathan and I talk about Buttondown's marketing approach and financial metrics.

name: Newsletter Crew
definition: Yaroslaw and I discuss the newsletter industry: how to choose a niche, how (and why) to monetize, and the common traits I notice across successful newsletters.

name: Level Up
definition: I chat about how I find time to work on my projects (and how I approach work-life balance in general.)

name: MintMakers
definition: I chat about my career, how I work on projects, and tips for aspiring developers & founders.

name: Productivity in Tech
definition: I chat about how I juggle and prioritize projects and also about my love for Python.

name: The Atlantic
definition: Buttondown's mentioned as an also-ran in the burgeoning email newsletters space. (Hey, I'll take the SEO!)

name: Vox
definition: Tinyletter — Buttondown's biggest competition in 2018 — was facing a lot of heat because the service had been mentioned as being sunset. I got to take advantage of this.

name: Gizmodo
definition: My first press clipping! I built a very fun and silly Twilio app that would respond to emojis with corgi pictures and it went briefly _extremely_ viral.

name: Medialyte
definition: I chatted with Mark Stenberg about the burgeoning "creator industry", why emails are, uh, not the perfect platform, and what I think is missing from the shift to a patronage-based economy.
